metadata.title: CVE-2023-38431 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.8.fs/smb/server/connection.c in ksmbd does not validate the relationshipbetween the NetBIOS header's length field and the SMB header sizes, viapdu_size in ksmbd_conn_handler_loop, leading to an out-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38431` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1016-oem - 6.1.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-aws - 6.2.0-1013.13~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-34.34~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic-64k - 6.2.0-34.34~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1014.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1014.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-gcp - 6.2.0-1016.18~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1014-azure - 6.2.0-1014.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-azure-fde - 6.2.0-1014.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-nvidia - 6.2.0-1011.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-nvidia-64k - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1006-starfive - 6.2.0-1006.7~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-6.2, was needs-triage').
